entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 10 at 2:48PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY ALONG KENAI RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River below Skilak Lake, including Kenai Keys. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Sunday Sep 17. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Kenai River and flood-prone locations is

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 10 at 9:17AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY FOR KENAI RIVER NEAR COOPER LANDING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by the Snow Glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River near Cooper Landing Through Skilak Lake. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 10 at 8:19PM PDT until September 11 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 5 feet. Higher surf of 6 feet or more is no longer expected. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Ventura County

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 09 at 1:52PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect until Monday at 7 AM. entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. .Water levels on the Myakka River continue to slowly fall. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:37AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of fog through 9 AM this morning... Areas of fog are developing over the northern and western Piedmont of central North Carolina, including the Triad region, early this morning. This fog will reduce visibilities to less than a mile in spots through 9 AM. Motorists are advised to use extra caution this morning. Slow down, use low beam headlights,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alamance; Chatham; Davidson; Durham; Forsyth; Granville; Guilford; Orange; Person; Randolph; Vance

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Expect patchy dense fog this morning, especially near lakes and rivers. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility, down to a quarter mile or less in some spots. Conditions will gradually improve after 8 AM. Use caution when traveling this morning. Give yourself extra time

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:49AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog This Morning... Plan on patchy dense fog this morning across the foothills and piedmont of Virginia and North Carolina. This includes the Roanoke Valley and Southside Virginia. The visibility will change rapidly down to one half mile or less in dense fog, especially along area rivers and lakes.
